title: Just how small is an atom?
description: Just how small are atoms? Really, really, really small. This fast-paced animation from TED-Ed uses metaphors (imagine a blueberry the size of a football stadium!) to give a visceral sense of just how small atoms are. Lesson by Jon Bergmann, animation by Cognitive Media.
author: Jon Bergmann
keywords: TED, talks, TED-Ed, science, physics, nanoscale, chemistry, quantum physics
